results.p: 7 days ago — 1. to remove the contents of : empty 2. to discharge from the body as waste : void 3. to remove something (such as gas or water) from especially by pumping.

results.t: EVACUATED | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to move people from a dangerous place to somewhere safe: The police evacuated the village shortly before the explosion.

results.t: EVACUATE | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to move people from a dangerous place to somewhere safe: The police evacuated the village shortly before the explosion.
verb (used with object) · to leave empty; vacate. · to remove (persons or things) from a place, as a dangerous place or disaster area, for reasons of safety or ...
To evacuate is to flee, like how people leave an area when a hurricane is coming. It also means to empty something completely.
evacuate in American English · 1. to make empty; remove the contents of; specif., to remove air from so as to make a vacuum · 2. to discharge (bodily waste, esp ...
[+ object] : to remove (someone) from a dangerous place. People who live along the coast are being evacuated as the hurricane approaches.
Evacuation definition: the act or process of evacuating, or the condition of being evacuated; discharge or expulsion, as of contents.

results.p: Synonyms for EVACUATED: emptied, cleared, cleaned, vacated, drained, eliminated, swept, exhausted; Antonyms of EVACUATED: filled, loaded.
